Learning Objects.value: – recall and summarize the meaning / job and personal qualities of a Receptionist.

Learning Activities.value: Students as a whole class revises their previous lessons and discuss in the class. -Students attempt some evaluation questions on last term’s topics.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Communication and collaboration, leadership and personal development skills.

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Specimen documents handled by Receptionist.

Topics.value: -Classification of office equipment with examples, uses,
-advantages and disadvantages of manual Office equipment.

Learning Objects.value: i. define Office Equipment.
ii. identify various Office equipment and their uses
ii. Justify the advantages and disadvantages of an office equipment.

Learning Activities.value: i. Whole class discussion on the meaning of Office equipment.
ii. students in small groups categories various Office equipment with examples, iii. debate on the advantages and disadvantages of various Office equipment.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Critical thinking and problems solving, communication and collaboration, leadership and personal development

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Computer, Photocopier, Telephone, stapler, perforator, etc, and web resources. Websites: https://content.Wisestep.com>list-of…https://www.dlta3teknik.com/lips-maintaining-office-equipment www.dlta3teknik.comlips-maintaining-office-equipment

Topics.value: ELECTRICAL/ELECTRONICS OFFICE EQUIPMENTS(Photocopier, Shredding machine, Frankling machine),(Computer, Scanning machine, Fax machine etc),
– Differences of: I. Manuel i. Electronics,2. Electrical office machines.
-Factors to consider when buying office equipment.

Learning Objects.value: -explain the meaning of Electrical and Electronics Office Equipment with their uses,
ii. enumerate the advantages and disadvantages of electrical and electronics office equipment
B. Recognize the different types of equipment end factors to considered in purchasing such equipment in an office.

Learning Activities.value: i. Students in a whole class, brainstorm on the meaning of Electronic Office Equipment.

ii. students in a small group, visit the school Secretary and Computer Office to identify and use sonic of the equipments.  iii. students in pairs categories equipment into Manual, Electrical and Electronics,
iv. students individually compare and contrast Electrical and Electronic Office Equipment.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Problems solving, communication and collaboration, students leadership and personal development

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Pictures and sample of some Electrical Office Equipment. e.g. Guillotine, Letter Opening machine, Frankling machine, pictures of different types of Electrical, Electronics and Manual machine
Web resources:website www.pinterest .com (office equipment) Google search.

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: i. analyse the meaning of an Office Automation
ii. Justify the usefulness of an Office Automation

Learning Activities.value: class deliberate on the possible meanings of Office Automation
ii. students in err al groups, debate on the benefits of an automated; office.

iii. students individually suggest how an office can be automised with the available technology. iv-for further studies, students visit the website provided to learn more about how to automise an Office.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Communication, office thinking and problems solving, creativity and innovation, and digital literacy.

Learning Objects.value: i. analyse some of the advantages and disadvantages o office automation system.
ii. justify the benefits of the society.

Learning Activities.value: i. Students in pairs justify some of the advantages and disadvantages of automation system of an Office and share with the class
ii. students in a small groups debate on the benefits to the society.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Collaboration and communication, critical thinking & problems solving, and students leadership & personal development and citizenship skills.

Learning Objects.value: i define a bank
ii. recognize a Central Bank.
iii-analyze different types of banks with their various functions.

Learning Activities.value: i. Students in a whole class, discuss the meaning of a bank,
ii.students in a small groups visit a nearby commercial and central bank
iii. each groups presents their observations from the visit to the class.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Communication and collaboration, critical thinking and problems solving students leadership & personal development .

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Chart / picture of a Commercial and Central Bank field trip to bank,
Web resources:Web link; https://study.com>academy >banking Video clips https://yôutu.be/LgYkBJqPYwl https://youtu.be/kDZ4IFK2054

Topics.value: Commercial banks -Meaning – functions -Types of bank accounts

Learning Objects.value: i. explain commercial banks
ii. identify functions of commercial banks to the country.
iii-analyze different types of banks account and how its been operated.

Learning Activities.value: i. Whole class brainstorm the meaning of Commercial bank .
ii. Students in a small groups enumerate services rendered by Commercial bank to the society and country at large and share with the class
iii. students in pairs explain the different types of bank accounts and how its been operated and share with the class.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Critical thinking & problems solving, and students leadership & personal development and citizenship skills.

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Chart / picture of a Commercial and Central Bank
Web resources:Video clips:https://yôutu.be/SRON4_G-wOc https://yôutu.be/xJRekYpag https://yôutu.be/wisOeEB46SI https://yôutu.be/coGkm6qiRWg

Topics.value: – Valid and Dishonored Reasons for dishonoring of cheque; Types and kinds of cheque.(Open, Bearer, Order, Crossed, Anti-dated Cheque, Post-dated and stale cheque)

Learning Objects.value: i-analyze a cheque as means of payment and parties involved in its;transaction  iii-recognize and differentiate a valid and dishonored cheque, and other types of cheque.
ii. evaluate the advantages and  disadvantages of a cheque as a means of payment.
iii-recognize and differentiate a valid and dishonored cheque, and other types of cheque.
-justify reasons for dishonoring a cheque.

Learning Activities.value: i. Students in small groups deliberate on the meaning of cheque as means of payment and identify parties involved in its transaction
ii. students evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of cheques transactions.
iii- Students individually identify types and kinds of cheques,
iv-students in whole class criticize;for dishonoring a cheque.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Critical thinking & problem solving, collaboration and communication, leadership; personal development skills

Learning Resources.value: Audio visual resources: Sample of a cheque booklet (valid and dishonored), samples of various types kinds of cheque.
web resources Web link: https://www.bankexamatoday.com https://business.jargon.com?cheque https://revision.com.zw>advantages.a…
